greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = -(A(n) - A(n-1)) where A(n) = A057597(n+1), for n >= 0.
comment: This sequence appears in the reduction formula for negative powers of the tribonacci constant t = A058265: t^(-n) = A(n)*t^2 + a(n)*t + A(n+1)*1, with A(n) = A057597(n+1), for n >= 0. This follows from t^3 = t^2 +  t + 1, or 1/t = t^2 - t - 1 = A192918, leading to the recurrence: A(n) = -A(n) - A(n-1) + A(n-2), with inputs A(-3) = 1, A(-2) = 1 and A(-1) = 0 and  a(n) = -(A(n) - A(n-1)). See the example below.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-1,-1,1).
formula: Recurrence  a(n) = -a(n-1) - a(n-2) + a(n-3), for n >=0, with a(-3) = 1, a(-2) = 0 and a(-1) = 1.
example: The coefficients of t^2, t, 1 for t^(-n) begin, for n >= -3:
program: (PARI) a057597(n) = polcoeff( if( n<0, x / ( 1 - x - x^2 - x^3), x^2 / ( 1 + x + x^2 - x^3) ) + x*O(x^abs(n)), abs(n)) \\ after _Michael Somos_ in A057597
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 23 2018
